meanings.definition: To forget or fail to retain information previously learned.
meanings.sent1: She unlearnt the lyrics to the song after not listening to it for a long time.
meanings.sent2: He unlearnt how to ride a bike after not practicing for years.
meanings.sent3: The student unlearnt the math formula right before the test, causing panic.
meanings.sent4: As time passed, she unlearnt the language she had once been fluent in.
meanings.sent5: The old man unlearnt many things as his memory started to fade.

meanings.definition: Not having acquired knowledge or skills through learning.
meanings.sent1: The unlearnt student struggled in the advanced class.
meanings.sent2: She felt unlearnt compared to her classmates who had studied the subject for years.
meanings.sent3: The unlearnt team had to work extra hard to catch up with the others.
meanings.sent4: He felt unlearnt in the new job, but he was determined to learn quickly.
meanings.sent5: The unlearnt child was eager to absorb new information and skills.
